title: Bridge the physical world: Kotlin/Native on Raspberry Pi
abstract: With Kotlin/Native, we can now compile Kotlin code to run on various platforms, including Raspberry Pi. This cross-platform ability has drawn the attention of many developers. Through the process of building a hand game robot which can play rock paper scissors with human beings, this talk aims to show you the possibility of using Kotlin to control GPIO pins on a Raspberry Pi and other experiments such as performing machine learning operations in Kotlin using TensorFlow backend, thanks to the interoperability with C libraries.
